update.description:
Add a class for showing a splash screen. The class takes an image file as an argument, and has a show() and hide() method.

We used to have splash screens, they didn't survive the port to Qt. But I've been using some slow computers lately and splash screens are nice to know something's happening, so I thought I'd resurrect them.

This one is using tkinter for the GUI so there are no expensive imports required for it to run, and it can be run early in program startup, maximising the proportion of time that something is showing.

It's not as fancy as the old one that used to print log info as it was starting. It just says 'loading' statically.

Requires pillow. Pillow comes with Anaconda, but I'll add it to the installer requirements.

Minor version bump so programs can rely on it.

Looks like this:

![splashscreen.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/KEMMje/images/2601513210-splashscreen.png)
update.title: Splash Screen

content.raw:
For Qt < 5.10 (conda is 5.9) on linux and macos this doesn't work, but this is a bug in Qt [now fixed](https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-4453) so I'm just going to leave it. It is also harmless. The bug is that `repaint()` calls have no effect while the event loop isn't running, so the splash screen simply isn't drawn (this code does not have the event loop running other than when it first shows the window, otherwise it would interfere with the application. I learned this by segfaulting BLACS.). 

Conda sticks to long term support releases of Qt so they will likely update to 5.12 soon which came out recently.
content.html:
For Qt < 5.10 (conda is 5.9) on linux and macos this doesn't work, but this is a bug in Qt now fixed so I'm just going to leave it. It is also harmless. The bug is that repaint() calls have no effect while the event loop isn't running, so the splash screen simply isn't drawn (this code does not have the event loop running other than when it first shows the window, otherwise it would interfere with the application. I learned this by segfaulting BLACS.).

Conda sticks to long term support releases of Qt so they will likely update to 5.12 soon which came out recently.

content.raw: It turns out there were issues with this with multiple monitors that were very difficult to handle in a cross platform way. So I decided to just do it in Qt where things are easy. There is no delay in importing Qt compared to tkinter, so it was pointless to avoid qt in the first place. There is also no obvious issues caused by the splash screen having its own QApplication.
content.html: It turns out there were issues with this with multiple monitors that were very difficult to handle in a cross platform way. So I decided to just do it in Qt where things are easy. There is no delay in importing Qt compared to tkinter, so it was pointless to avoid qt in the first place. There is also no obvious issues caused by the splash screen having its own QApplication.
